articles.title: Future COVID variants likely to infect us differently: Expert explains why | Mint - Mint
articles.description: If some variants are able to replicate faster, then they might be more infectious because you’re getting higher viral loads faster in the nasal cavity, expert said
articles.content: New COVID variants, as and when it evolves, might infect us differently, a new study showed. Explaining this, Megan Steain, a virologist at the University of Sydney, Australia, said, If some variants… [+2240 chars]
